6) Suppose we make fully-decentralised games with assets owned by the token holdersâ€”that are more fun to play than their mainstream competitors. Plus, we give them the ability to earn. Would 3b gamers decline the invite to this space?
5) We need to focus on critical things the mainstream can't replicate unless they move into our spaceâ€”such as ownership over your assets.

4) We know, as crypto natives, that this revolution has already begunâ€¦ But to a newcomer, imagine seeing a sign "Play-2-Earn". Their immediate reaction would probably be â€œThis is too good to be true.â€

3) Same thing with P2E and particularly in-game yield; while it is incredible, and I think it gives us the ability to onboard an entirely new subset of the population, it can not and should not be the entire reason someone is playing a video game.

2) While technically possible, interoperability across the Metaverse is insanely complex and requires extreme collaboration between projects. The starting point is assets are interoperable within the same ecosystem.
